text: Proteobacteria (Gram-negative) have a thin cell wall with one or two layers of peptidoglycan, enclosed by an outer membrane.
The phylum Proteobacteria consists of Gram-negative species such as Escherichia coli and nitrogen-fixing Sinorhizobium meliloti.
Archaea have yet other diverse kinds of envelopes that cannot be distinguished by Gram stain (see Chapter 19).
the Gram-positive cell wall consist of glycerol or ribitol phosphodiester chains.
